sentence.Network_en: I was certain I was on the brink of poverty, going to the poorhouse.
sentence.Network_cn: 我确信自己已处在贫困的边缘，马上就要进济贫院了。

sentence.Network_en: You may perhaps have some pleasant, drilling, glorious hours, even in a poorhouse.
sentence.Network_cn: 甚至在一个济贫院里,你也还有愉快 、 兴 、 荣的时候.

poor：贫穷与可怜息息相关_清抹侃英语_天涯博客 ... poor-compactibility 低成型性 poorhouse 济贫院 poor-mouth 以贫穷作借口.

list.abs: don't let emotional upset force you into the poorhouse .别因情感冲动而陷入财政困境。

entry.tran: （旧时英国公办的）贫民所，济贫院
entry.def: In former times in Britain, a poorhouse was an institution in which poor people could live. It was paid for by the public.

example.ex: I was certain I was on the brink of poverty, going to the poorhouse.
example.tran: 我确信自己已处在贫困的边缘，马上就要进济贫院了。

means.word_mean: 1. an establishment maintained at public expense in order to provide housing for the poor and homeless

auth_sentence.content: He's not going to be put in no poorhouse.
auth_sentence.res_content: He's not going to be put in no poorhouse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He's not going to be put in no poorhouse.

auth_sentence.content: Don't tell them they'll end up in the poorhouse if they don't buy a product.
auth_sentence.res_content: Don't tell them they'll end up in the poorhouse if they don't buy a product.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Don't tell them they'll end up in the poorhouse if they don't buy a product.
